list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: attach or fasten (someone or something) with string or similar cord.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: they tied Max to a chair
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Họ buộc max tối đa vào ghế

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: restrict or limit (someone) to a particular situation, occupation, or place.
achieve the same score or ranking as another competitor or team.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: he tied for second in the league
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Anh buộc người thứ hai trong giải đấu

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: a piece of string, cord, or the like used for fastening or tying something.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: he tightened the tie of his robe
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Anh siết chặt cà vạt áo choàng của mình

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: a rod or beam holding parts of a structure together.
a thing that unites or links people.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: it is important that we keep family ties strong
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Điều quan trọng là chúng tôi giữ mối quan hệ gia đình mạnh mẽ

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: a strip of material worn around the collar and tied in a knot at the front with the ends hanging down, typically forming part of a man's business or formal outfit; a necktie.
a result in a game or other competitive situation in which two or more competitors or teams have the same score or ranking; a draw.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: there was a tie for first place
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Có một cà vạt cho vị trí đầu tiên
